channel.title: The Answering Machine
channel.description: A comedy podcast involving "found" answering machine messages from years past, performed by some of the best and funniest comedians today.

item.title: Episode 10 - Mitchell Klein
item.description: The Answering Machine is back with a brand new episode! This time we explore the answering machine messages of Mitchell Klein, the head of the legendary record label Zeus Records, who decided to put together a benefit concert in the wake of the 9/11 attacks. With Brett Davis, Josh Fadem, Zack Kahn, Mary Novokhovsky, Naomi Rohatyn and Riley Trela!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Answering Machine is back with a brand new episode! This time we explore the answering machine messages of Mitchell Klein, the head of the legendary record label Zeus Records, who decided to put together a benefit concert in the wake of the 9/11...

item.title: Episode 9 - Bonnie Rhodes
item.description: The Answering Machine is back with another hilarious, exciting episode! This time we explore the answering machine messages of Bonnie Rhodes, the secretary to Atlanta mayor Wallace MacDougal. Listen as Bonnie juggles her delinquent brother, a Southern gentleman, and her boss' insane idea of turning a major city into a Batman-themed wonderland. Batlanta!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Answering Machine - Don Takano

item.title: Episode 8 - Howard Stetson
item.description: The Answering Machine is back for 2014 with a brand new episode, exploring the lost answering machine messages of Howard Stetson, a man who had juggled a troubled marriage, a potential white collar felony and a pathetic neighbor, among other atrocities.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Answering Machine is back for 2014 with a brand new episode, exploring the lost answering machine messages of Howard Stetson, a man who had juggled a troubled marriage, a potential white collar felony and a pathetic neighbor, among other atrocities.

item.title: Episode 7 - Evelyn Taggart
item.description: The Answering Machine is back with a brand new episode! This time, we explore the voicemail messages of Evelyn Taggart, a God-fearing family woman from Picayune, Mississppi. Homophobia, Nigerian email scams, and other hijinks abound in this hilarious episode!
item.itunes:subtitle: The Answering Machine is back with a brand new episode! This time, we explore the voicemail messages of Evelyn Taggart, a God-fearing family woman from Picayune, Mississppi. Homophobia, Nigerian email scams, and other hijinks abound in this hilarious...

item.title: Episode 6 - Randall McMillan
item.description: After a 3-month hiatus, The Answering Machine is back with a brand new episode, this time chronicling Texas college freshman Randall McMillan. Listen as McMillan juggles college life, a stepfather he dislikes and a sudden addiction to steroids. Be sure to LIKE The Answering Machine Podcast Facebook page!
item.itunes:subtitle: After a 3-month hiatus, The Answering Machine is back with a brand new episode, this time chronicling Texas college freshman Randall McMillan. Listen as McMillan juggles college life, a stepfather he dislikes and a sudden addiction to steroids. Be...

item.title: Episode 5 - Willie Walker
item.description:
The Answering Machine is back after a month with a hilarious new episode! This time, we examine the answering machine messages of Willie Walker, recorded during December of 2004. Walker, who was 90 at the time, was a legendary blues musician living in Detroit. From a pair of duelling documentary filmmakers to an obsessive record collector, to Walker's own abandoned grandson, this episode of The Answering Machine is one for the ages!

Cast of Performers (in alphabetical order):

Tony Bartolone as the Hard Rock Cafe Manager

Laura Crawford as the mother of teenage prank caller

Brett Davis as Terry Harper

Jim Earl as Ken Burns

Greg Edwards as Fort Hard Knox

Zack Kahn as Ari Goldstein

Darius Kennedy as Andre Walker

Pat Regan as teenage prank caller

Heather Thomson as Willa Courtney
item.itunes:subtitle: The Answering Machine is back after a month with a hilarious new episode! This time, we examine the answering machine messages of Willie Walker, recorded during December of 2004. Walker, who was 90 at the time, was a legendary blues musician living in...

item.title: Episode 4 - Rhonda Cartwright
item.description:
The Answering Machine is back with another exciting episode! This time we go back to 1997 where Rhonda Cartwright is planning her 8-year-old son's birthday party! Rhonda tries to hire everyone from a live tiger to Derek Jeter to Aerosmith. Hijinks ensue when her brother, Vince Cartwright (aka Dopey the Clown) isn't invited, and her teenage daughter is somehow drifting apart from her.

Cast of Performers (in alphabetical order):

Chase Bernstein as the Carvel Cake Company Customer Service Rep

Brandon Burkhart as the Foster National Bank Loan Rep

Eric Dadourian as Derek Jeter

Megan Koester as Madeline Gore

Scott Luhrs as the Pinata Warehouse Customer Service Rep

Naomi Rohatyn as Amber Cartwright

Morgan Russell as Carly Cole

Nick Rutherford as Yuri Nunencort

Don Takano as Tom Carvel and Pepe, the Mascot for Pinata Warehouse

Chuck Watkins as Vince Cartwright/Dopey the Clown

item.title: Episode 3 - Walt Bailey
item.description:
The Answering Machine returns with a brand new, hilarious episode! This time around, we examine the answering machine messages of Walt Bailey, a retired insurance salesman outside of Kansas City during the summer of 1988. Bailey won a fishing boat on Wheel of Fortune, much to the dismay of his wife, Nancy. Meanwhile, his friend, George Crowley, a police officer, is getting Walt some free illegal cable television, while his son, Stephen, got in trouble at summer camp. All this and more unravels in Episode 3 of The Answering Machine!

Cast of Performers (In alphabetical order):

Ron Babcock as George Crowley

Drew Blomquist as “Jackrabbit”

Mr. Goodnight as Abel Kachaikis the marriage counselor

Lisa Beth Johnson as Walt’s wife

Mike Knish as Walt’s teenage son

Rivers Langley as the Bass Pro Shops Customer Service Representative

Luke Pennington as the Boat Insurance salesman

Naomi Rohatyn as the camp director of Camp Brave

Don Takano as Pete Hoffman and Pat Sajak

item.title: Episode 2 - Barbi Foxx
item.description:
Episode 2 centers on Barbi Foxx. Formerly known as Diane Matthews, she moved to Hollywood in the early 1990’s, dyed her hair blonde and was known as Barbi Foxx. A former Playboy Playmate and Baywatch co-star, Barbi Foxx has dated many former “celebrities” and has made some poor decisions. Enjoy another hilarious episode of The Answering Machine!

Cast of Episode 2 (in alphabetical order):

Sofiya Alexandra as Tiara Carson

Nick Bahr as Sal Powers

Brett Davis as Dan Cortese

Zack Kahn as the CEO of Sex Breeze Wine Coolers

Asterios Kokkinos as Hugh Hefner

Joe McAvoy as Chip, Barbi’s Stalker

Cornell Reid as Scott Baio

Ric Rosario as the Sharper Image Black Catalog Customer Service Rep

April Hava Shenkman as Barbi’s mother

Tom Sibley as Wick Goldman

item.title: Episode 1 - Jeff Downey
item.description:
Episode 1 is the story of Jeff Downey, a 22 year old kid from Harrisburg, PA, and takes place during March of 1992. Based on the answering machine messages compiled on him, Downey was a rebellious sort, as he possibly may have burned down the pizza place he worked at, which at the time was known as Moose-olini’s Pizza, a popular pizza chain in the tri-state area, renowned for its mascot, an animated, pizza-craving moose named Bennie the Moose (it is rumored that actor Joe Pesci provided the voice). Also, his mother is afraid that he is a heroin addict, his girlfriend thinks his punk band, Pokey, is trying too hard to sound like Operation Ivy, and the manager of the local video store is looking for Downey’s overdue rentals of such classics as Dolph Lundgren’s I Come in Peace and Martin Lawrence’s Talkin’ Dirty After Dark. Also, the Columbia House Record Club is going to take legal action for Downey’s nasty letter in response to receiving a cassette from early 90’s one hit wonders EMF.

Starring in Alphabetical Order:

Brett Davis as Tommy, the co-worker at Moose-olini’s pizza

Josh Fadem as Arnold Brunetti, the CEO of Moose-olini’s pizza

Nick Flanagan as the Angry, Young and Poor catalog representative

Naomi Rohatyn as Jennifer, Jeff’s girlfriend

Dave Ross as Richard, the manager at Video Shack

Morgan Russell as Jeff’s mother

Travis Rust as Neil, Jeff’s bandmate

Andy Sell as Kevin, Jeff’s roommate

Don Takano as Frank Atlas the fitness instructor; Bennie the Moose, the mascot of Moose-olini’s Pizza

Paige Weldon as Myra, the Columbia House Record Club Customer service rep

Allen Strickland Williams as Howard, the attorney representing the Columbia House Record Club
